notes.text:
Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security. The updated image includes a bug fix and security fixes.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score,
which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability
from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of RHACS 4.5.5 introduces the following changes:

Bug fix:

* Fixed an issue with redirects in curl commands leading to empty files and errors in scanning. (ROX-26929)

* Scanner V4 now reindexes image upon indexer updates. (ROX-23956)

Security fixes:

* encoding/gob: golang: Calling Decoder.Decode on a message which contains
deeply nested structures can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion
(CVE-2024-34156)

* body-parser: Denial of Service Vulnerability in body-parser (CVE-2024-45590)

* dompurify: DOMPurify vulnerable to tampering by prototype pollution
(CVE-2024-48910)

* golang: archive/zip: Incorrect handling of certain ZIP files (CVE-2024-24789)

* golang: net/netip: Unexpected behavior from Is methods for IPv4-mapped IPv6
addresses (CVE-2024-24790)

* cross-spawn: Regular expression denial of service (CVE-2024-21538)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the
References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability was found in the cross-spawn package for Node.js. Due to improper input sanitization, an attacker can increase CPU usage and crash the program with a large, specially crafted string.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: cross-spawn: regular expression denial of service
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.5.

vulnerabilities.title: cross-spawn: regular expression denial of service

notes.text: A flaw was found in Golang. The ZIP implementation of the Go language archive/zip library behaves differently than the rest of the ZIP file format implementations. When handling ZIP files with a corrupted central directory record, the library skips over the invalid record and processes the next valid one. This flaw allows a malicious user to access hidden information or files inside maliciously crafted ZIP files.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: archive/zip: Incorrect handling of certain ZIP files
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.5.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: archive/zip: Incorrect handling of certain ZIP files

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Go language standard library net/netip. The method Is*() (IsPrivate(), IsPublic(), etc) doesn't behave properly when working with IPv6 mapped to IPv4 addresses. The unexpected behavior can lead to integrity and confidentiality issues, specifically when these methods are used to control access to resources or data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/netip: Unexpected behavior from Is methods for IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This CVE has been marked as moderate as for our products a network-based attack vector is simply impossible when it comes to golang code,apart from that as per CVE flaw analysis reported by golang, this only affects integrity and confidentiality and has no effect on availability, hence CVSS has been marked as such.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.5.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/netip: Unexpected behavior from Is methods for IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses

notes.text: A flaw was found in the encoding/gob package of the Golang standard library. Calling Decoder.Decoding, a message that contains deeply nested structures, can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion. This is a follow-up to CVE-2022-30635.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: encoding/gob: golang: Calling Decoder.Decode on a message which contains deeply nested structures can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability in Go's `encoding/gob` package is of high severity because it exposes applications to potential Denial of Service (DoS) attacks through stack exhaustion. Since `gob` relies on recursive function calls to decode nested structures, an attacker could exploit this by sending crafted messages with excessively deep nesting, causing the application to panic due to stack overflow. This risk is particularly important in scenarios where untrusted or external input is processed, as it can lead to system unavailability or crashes, undermining the reliability and availability of services.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.5.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: encoding/gob: golang: Calling Decoder.Decode on a message which contains deeply nested structures can cause a panic due to stack exhaustion

notes.text: A flaw was found in body-parser. This vulnerability causes denial of service via a specially crafted payload when the URL encoding is enabled.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: body-parser: Denial of Service Vulnerability in body-parser
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: body-parser: Denial of Service Vulnerability in body-parser

cwe.name: Improperly Controlled Modification of Object Prototype Attributes ('Prototype Pollution')

notes.text: A prototype pollution vulnerability was found in DOMPurify. This flaw allows a remote attacker to add or modify attributes of an object prototype. This issue can lead to the injection of malicious attributes used in other components or cause a crash by overriding existing attributes with ones of incompatible type.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dompurify: DOMPurify vulnerable to tampering by prototype pollution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The prototype pollution vulnerability in DOMPurify is considered a high-severity issue because it allows attackers to modify the prototype of built-in JavaScript objects, potentially impacting the entire application. This could lead to security risks, such as overwriting methods on fundamental objects like `Object`, `Array`, or `Function`, allowing attackers to manipulate application behavior, bypass security controls, or cause application crashes. Given that DOMPurify is a core library for sanitizing user input, an attacker exploiting this vulnerability could gain control over how sanitized content is processed, leading to the execution of malicious scripts or triggering other unintended behaviors across the application.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.5.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options do not meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.
